content.description: Start at the back of the roof at climber's left of the boulder.  Follow a horizontal jug flake to the lip of the roof and find your way to the top edge of the boulder using a pad and a half sloper edge.  If you traverse onto holds that you'd use for Corsair, you're probably too far right.
content.protection: 3 pads work well so you don't have to shuffle.
content.location: Stella and Micah's book is vague on how to start- but you can match the good edge and throw a high left heel to begin.

content.description: Start in a jug horizontal at the back of the roof.  Use a triangular foothold however you can to get to the next jug horizontal past the wide roof.  Follow a jug rail up and climber's left and do a long move to the fin to top out.
content.location: The start is obvious, especially if you follow Stella's beta in the book.  There is an almost identical (but less fun IMO) V4 immediately "downhill" of Corsair.

content.description:
Start in the horizontal at the back of the roof several feet right of

Corsair

.  Climb out the roof to a sloping topout.

Start at the left edge of the boulder underneath the roof.  The start is shared with Uncle Dave's Porno Bin.  Shoot for good but rounded, sloper-ish holds that traverse the top lip of the left side of the boulder.  Figure out the feet for the awkward, hip-intensive topout move on a massive jug.
content.protection: Putting a pad on the very close boulder that's underneath you as you pull the crux moves is a good idea.
content.location: The left-most problem on the Corsair boulder.
